SEARCH
Package pucrs.alest2.assignment2.rsuffert

Class Graph

java.lang.Object
pucrs.alest2.assignment2.rsuffert.Graph
public class Graph extends Object
The Graph class is the implementation of a graph for the Phoenician problem, based off of Robert Sedgewick's and Kevin Wayne's implementation for a graph of integer vertices, which uses an array of Bag elements to store the vertices of the graph and the adjacency list of each one of them.

  • Constructor Details

    • Graph

      public Graph(String path) throws IOException, InvalidPathException
      Constructs an empty graph based on a certain input file, which must conform with the specification for input files for this program. For additional information, check the docs folder.
      Parameters:
      path - the string representing the path to the file that contains the map to be converted into a graph
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occures (for example, if the file could not be read)
      InvalidPathException - if the String object representing the path (the parameter path) is null

  • Method Details

    • translateVertexCode

      public Character translateVertexCode(int code)
      Translates a given vertex code to its respective character (actual value).
      Parameters:
      code - the vertex code
      Returns:
      the character associated with code, or null if there isn't any character associated with it

    • translatePortToCode

      public Integer translatePortToCode(int portNumber)
      Translates a given port number to its respective code in the graph datastructure.
      Parameters:
      portNumber - the number of the port
      Returns:
      the integer value representing the code associated with the portNumber parameter, or null if the port is not in the graph

    • adj

      public Iterable<Integer> adj(int v)
      Returns the vertices adjacent to vertex v.
      Parameters:
      v - the vertex
      Returns:
      the vertices adjacent to vertex v, as an iterable
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - unless 0 <= v < V

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this graph.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
